::Prowl/Firearm/Grimmler/Fliq::

Prowl listened to Iron Raptor's acceptance of his offer for a date, 
smiling to himself. He was kinda embarrased at causing her to almost 
fall, but he was very happy that she had accepted the date. He felt 
the feeling from her that they were starting all over again, but he 
didn't think so. Prowl was about to reply to her thoughts when he saw 
the screen come to life, listening to WildWing's message and then to 
IR's orders.

-Can do, love. I'll be right there, I gotta get something really 
quick.- Prowl thought to Iron Raptor, hugging and kissing her quickly 
before bolting down the hallway. He turned a few corners, skidding to 
a stop in front of a door and looking at it before entering the room 
behind it.

The room was Bluestreak's quarters. Prowl looked around, feeling sad 
that his brother had left earth. They had fought together many times 
and yet... Somehow he knew that they had fought together, but he did 
not remember almost anything about them fighting together. There was 
something missing in his memory, something major. But as much as he 
tried to remember, he still couldn't. It was a big huge chunk, 
everything before the time he had woken up as a Maximal was lost to 
him, and he knew there was alot there.

Prowl searched for a short while untill he found what Bluestreak had 
left him upon departing from earth: Bluestreak's daggers. Prowl help 
them up, looking them over. He sighed. Even though Bluestreak hadn't 
spent too much time on earth, Prowl would miss him. He looked down at 
his arms, the pannels of the forearms sliding aside to reveal a space 
to store the daggers. One by one Prowl put them in the storage 
places, knowing that they could edject from his palms on command. He 
searched his data-tracks, and surprisingly found that he knew 
perfectly how he used them. Prowl chuckled. The Matrix definetly had 
some insight while making this body..

"Thanks, Bluestreak," he said to the air around him, walking out of 
the room and taking a last look at it before closing the door and 
running to the shuttle bay.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Firearm's head nearly smashes upward into the console he was working 
on as he hears the news of the Ark being attacked. It was in space, 
and Predacons were STILL crazy enough to attack it, even if they had 
to go so much further for it! What was it with these Preds.

"Allright, let's go guys," he says to Grimmler and Fliq. He looks at 
Hysteria.

"Keep things going here. We'll be back soon."

With that, Firearm takes off running toward the shuttle bay with 
Firearm, Grimmler, and Fliq following him.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Firearm, Grimmler, and Fliq arrive at the shuttle bay around the same 
time as Prowl, the four looking at each other.

"Firearm, you come with me. I'll need your knowledge of the ship to 
give some orders," Prowl says, him and Firearm entering a shuttle. 
Grimmler and Fliq enter another one and the two shuttles blast off at 
the same time. After a few seconds of conversing with Firearm, Prowl 
activates the shuttle's comm.

"Ok, guys," he says into it, the transmission going to the other 
Maximal shuttles, "Iron is putting me in charge up there, so if you 
need any orders talk to me. Some things you should know:"

He checks the scanners on the shuttle, which were linked with the 
Cybertronian Fire. "There are two Predacon shuttles in the area, and 
three more crafts flying in. All of those are likely to have weapons. 
Fortunately, our shuttles do as well. The weapons are not efficient 
in atmosphere because of the energy they divert from the engines, but 
in space they will work fine. Try to disable as many ships as you can 
before engaging the Predacons. All the shuttles have superior aiming 
to us normal bots."

Prowl glances slightly at Firearm to make sure he was getting all 
this right. Firearm nods, confirming that Prowl was correct. The 
feathered Maximal continues. "The shuttles have an autopilot mode 
that will take them back to the Cybertronian Fire, so once your 
shuttle is no longer useful, edject and let it go back home. They'll 
send up shuttles for us once we win. If your shuttle is under heavy 
fire, edject. Only one bot is needed to pilot and fire, so everyone 
else can edject at the very beginning. This is a no-fail mission, 
guys. We've lost the Ark before, we can't afford to do it again. 
Let's get this right. Keep yourselves functional, we've lost enough 
at the CF."

Prowl shuts off the comm, looking out of the viewport. They were 
still in the atmosphere, but would soon exit it and head for the 
moon, around which the Ark was orbiting. Prowl sighed. There was 
something important at the Ark. Not important in the sence of being 
his ancestors, but more important, like part of himself. He wondered 
why he hadn't felt that before, but ever since the Matrix brought him 
and Iron Raptor back after his screw-up, he had been slightly 
telepathic. He figured that might be it. Whatever it was, he would 
soon find out.

Behind Prowl, Firearm was charging up his arm cannon and preparing 
his optic lasers. He had no idea that the bot that he was about to 
fight was the very one who's group had slaughtered the entire space 
colony he had been defending. If he had known that he would meet 
Killfest at this battle, or that Killfest was even on this planet, he 
would have prepared much better.
